title: Domain 2.4: Summarize services provided by networked hosts.
content:
🧰 Server Roles (2.4 – Left Column)

🌍 DNS (Domain Name System)

Converts domain names (like google.com) to IP addresses.
Without it, you'd have to remember IPs to access websites.

🧠 Exam Tip: If web pages aren’t loading but IP pings work, check DNS settings.

📦 DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol)

Automatically assigns IP addresses, subnet masks, gateways, and DNS.
Saves you from manually configuring each device.

🧠 Tip: If devices have 169.x.x.x addresses, DHCP probably failed.

📁 File Share Server

Central storage space where users can upload/download files.
Uses SMB (Windows) or NFS (Linux/Unix) protocols.

🧠 Tip: File server = shared drive (often mapped as a network drive).

🖨️ Print Server

Manages access to networked printers.
Handles print jobs, queues, and drivers.

🧠 Tip: Can be software-based (Windows Server) or built into the printer.

📬 Mail Server

Sends and receives email.
Uses SMTP, POP3, or IMAP.

🧠 Tip: Microsoft Exchange is a popular enterprise mail server.

📜 Syslog Server

Collects and stores log messages from other devices.
Used for centralized logging and auditing.
Common in Linux environments.

🧠 Tip: Important for security, troubleshooting, and compliance.

🌐 Web Server

Hosts websites or web apps.
Responds to HTTP/HTTPS requests from clients.

🧠 Tip: Common software: Apache, NGINX, IIS (Windows)

🔐 AAA Server (Authentication, Authorization, Accounting)

Verifies user identity (Authentication).
Grants access permissions (Authorization).
Tracks usage for billing/audits (Accounting).

🧠 Tip: Often uses RADIUS or TACACS+ protocols.

🌐 INTERNET APPLIANCES

🚫 Spam Gateways

Filters unwanted email (spam/phishing) before it reaches inboxes.
Can be a hardware appliance or cloud service.
Protects against malware-laced messages.

🧠 Tip: If users complain about spam bypassing filters, check spam gateway settings.

🛡️ Unified Threat Management (UTM)

All-in-one security device:

  • Firewall
  • Antivirus
  • VPN
  • IDS/IPS (Intrusion Detection/Prevention)
  • Content filtering

🧠 Tip: Great for small-to-mid businesses that want centralized security.

⚖️ Load Balancers

Distribute network or app traffic across multiple servers.
Prevents overload, improves performance and redundancy.

🧠 Tip: If one web server fails, load balancer reroutes traffic to another automatically.

🌐 Proxy Servers

Middle-man between client and internet.
Caches content, filters web access, hides internal IPs.

🧠 Tip: If a website is blocked or loads from cache, a proxy server may be involved.

⚙️ LEGACY/EMBEDDED SYSTEMS

🏭 SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition)

Used to monitor/control industrial systems (like water plants, power grids).
Often runs on old/unsupported OS — vulnerable if not isolated.

🧠 Tip: SCADA = critical infrastructure, often targeted in cyber attacks.

📲 INTERNET OF THINGS (IoT) DEVICES

Everyday smart devices connected to a network:

  • Smart TVs
  • Smart thermostats
  • Doorbell cameras
  • Wearables
